componenttext: Stewart Scharf. Regarding the regions in Europe and the impact, especially like in Spain and the U.K., could you guys break that down a little bit?

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: We don't break by country. Overall, in the segment reporting itself, Europe in total was about $72.7 million in revenues and the other international locations were at $59.6 million in revenues.
componenttext: We don't break by country. Overall, in the segment reporting itself, Europe in total was about $72.7 million in revenues and the other international locations were at $59.6 million in revenues.

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: Okay. And regarding the call centers, could you elaborate a little more on that as far as the number of people and how you're allocating patient communications and so forth?
componenttext: Okay. And regarding the call centers, could you elaborate a little more on that as far as the number of people and how you're allocating patient communications and so forth?

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: The call centers that we have, obviously at this point have been acquired, which obviously, where there's lots of resource that we're now trying to optimize not only their efficiency but also the tools that they use, the infrastructure and technology that
componenttext: The call centers that we have, obviously at this point have been acquired, which obviously, where there's lots of resource that we're now trying to optimize not only their efficiency but also the tools that they use, the infrastructure and technology that they use to do their business. And so all those efforts allow us to improve that business and to look for integration there and to also add additional services to that over time.

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: Okay. And also regarding the multiple services -- and you've said for a while that the SQ was basically 80% for the single serve and for the LQ around 70%. And do you have a time frame or a goal for expanding that to multiple services and improving that p
componenttext: Okay. And also regarding the multiple services -- and you've said for a while that the SQ was basically 80% for the single serve and for the LQ around 70%. And do you have a time frame or a goal for expanding that to multiple services and improving that percentage?

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: The percentage heavily depends on obviously how many customers we acquire. And because we keep acquiring customers on a worldwide basis, the opportunity remains really open to us and the percentage is very close every quarter-to-quarter. The number isn't
componenttext: The percentage heavily depends on obviously how many customers we acquire. And because we keep acquiring customers on a worldwide basis, the opportunity remains really open to us and the percentage is very close every quarter-to-quarter. The number isn't changing, which on the one side you would maybe say, "Well, what is it going to do? Where are you going to take it?" Again, because of our continued acquisition, that number and that opportunity that we have remains very large for us.

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: Okay. And just one more quick one, regarding the elections. And I know that's not a major driver for what you're looking at. You're looking more at the baby-boom and the long term. But assuming there was Obamacare and there was a shift from, say, emergenc
componenttext: Okay. And just one more quick one, regarding the elections. And I know that's not a major driver for what you're looking at. You're looking more at the baby-boom and the long term. But assuming there was Obamacare and there was a shift from, say, emergency rooms to smaller clinics, is there any way to quantify that?

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: We haven't really quantified. We think the Affordable Care Act, or Obamacare, obviously, we anticipate more people being insured. To your point, that probably does move volumes from the emergency room to SQ, which we think is good for us. It gives us the
componenttext: We haven't really quantified. We think the Affordable Care Act, or Obamacare, obviously, we anticipate more people being insured. To your point, that probably does move volumes from the emergency room to SQ, which we think is good for us. It gives us the opportunity to sell more services. That should be favorable. If we look at Massachusetts, and a lot of people point to Massachusetts, because they do have a similar type of health-care system, the studies that we've done internally, we have seen volumes increasing, especially in the SQ world, in that state. So we look at that as a favorable outcome. So we'll see. It's too early to tell, but that's one thing that we can point to as something that's been favorable for us.

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: Your next question comes from the line of Barbara Noverini from Morningstar.
componenttext: Your next question comes from the line of Barbara Noverini from Morningstar.

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: Could you give us maybe some color, or an update on the competitive dynamics of the Pharma Waste space? Have you been seeing competition heat up, maybe some new entrants into the market given the relatively attractive opportunity going forward?
componenttext: Could you give us maybe some color, or an update on the competitive dynamics of the Pharma Waste space? Have you been seeing competition heat up, maybe some new entrants into the market given the relatively attractive opportunity going forward?

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: Yes. I think if you look at the competitive landscape for Pharma Waste -- and when we look at Pharma Waste, we're specifically looking at LQ, the hospital market. You have a lot of regional companies, regional hazardous-waste companies that are in that sp
componenttext: Yes. I think if you look at the competitive landscape for Pharma Waste -- and when we look at Pharma Waste, we're specifically looking at LQ, the hospital market. You have a lot of regional companies, regional hazardous-waste companies that are in that space. And then on a national or semi-national platform, folks like waste management and clean harbors, I think the advantage that we have is the relationships that we have within health care. So I think, quickly, we've taken a leadership position for that type of service offering and when we look at the opportunity we have, when a hospital does outsource that program, we do close a large percentage of those accounts. And I think that's because of the leadership position we have within health care.

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: Got it. And how would you say the rate of growth of Pharma Waste compares with the other services available to LQ customers?
componenttext: Got it. And how would you say the rate of growth of Pharma Waste compares with the other services available to LQ customers?

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: It's at a higher growth rate, but it's also -- we're in an earlier inning there.
componenttext: It's at a higher growth rate, but it's also -- we're in an earlier inning there.

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: And your next question comes from the line of Richard Close.
componenttext: And your next question comes from the line of Richard Close.

componenttext: Just a follow-up on that. Did you say what your penetration rate was on Rx Waste with your customers? Have you given that?

componenttextpreview: No, we did not.
componenttext: No, we did not.

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: We're in the early stages of that service offering.
componenttext: We're in the early stages of that service offering.

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then when we think of patient communications -- and I know obviously a lot of talk there. Just to be clear, there was not any acquisitions in the patient communications in the third quarter. That's correct.
componenttext: Okay. And then when we think of patient communications -- and I know obviously a lot of talk there. Just to be clear, there was not any acquisitions in the patient communications in the third quarter. That's correct.

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: That is correct.
componenttext: That is correct.

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: Okay. And on a go-forward basis, can you give us a little bit of, I guess, update with respect to when do you expect -- or maybe you won't do this, but brand this as "Stericycle Patient Communications?" Or are these acquisitions you've done still operatin
componenttext: Okay. And on a go-forward basis, can you give us a little bit of, I guess, update with respect to when do you expect -- or maybe you won't do this, but brand this as "Stericycle Patient Communications?" Or are these acquisitions you've done still operating as the -- under the existing names?

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: Yes. I think it's a mix. We have certainly the platform acquisition that we did, which was NotifyMD. We continue to use that name. Some of the acquisitions that we have completed, we have branded them NotifyMD, but not all. I think it's too early to tell.
componenttext: Yes. I think it's a mix. We have certainly the platform acquisition that we did, which was NotifyMD. We continue to use that name. Some of the acquisitions that we have completed, we have branded them NotifyMD, but not all. I think it's too early to tell. We're looking still from -- and that's as far as the piloting on the sales and marketing strategy on how do we brand that service offering.

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: Okay. And is there any opportunity for the patient communications to be leveraged into the LQ base? I would assume you have some national accounts that this would be an attractive service for.
componenttext: Okay. And is there any opportunity for the patient communications to be leveraged into the LQ base? I would assume you have some national accounts that this would be an attractive service for.

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: Oh, absolutely. I mean, in the acquisitions we've made, there've been both LQ and SQ customers. I think the LQ one is interesting. From the Affordable Care Act and the way that hospitals are being reimbursed, there is certainly an opportunity that now tha
componenttext: Oh, absolutely. I mean, in the acquisitions we've made, there've been both LQ and SQ customers. I think the LQ one is interesting. From the Affordable Care Act and the way that hospitals are being reimbursed, there is certainly an opportunity that now that it's based on patient satisfaction and outcomes, that how a hospital communicates with the patients -- there's been a lot of white papers. The better that they communicate with their patients, the better the outcome. So we think there could be some great opportunities on the LQ side. But right now, the focus has been mostly on the SQ side.

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then any update with respect to the ability to, I guess, ramp up the SQ on the international front, how that is progressing?
componenttext: Okay. And then any update with respect to the ability to, I guess, ramp up the SQ on the international front, how that is progressing?

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: That's on track. I mean, there is definitely focus. As we've said in the past, the equivalent of Steri-Safe is expanded internationally and it's called to the compliance program there. So it definitely is on track and continues to grow there.
componenttext: That's on track. I mean, there is definitely focus. As we've said in the past, the equivalent of Steri-Safe is expanded internationally and it's called to the compliance program there. So it definitely is on track and continues to grow there.

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then final question for me. I would be interested in hearing your thoughts on the retail front. I think you guys have been doing some business with respect to national accounts on returns or waste disposal on large retail customers. Any thoughts
componenttext: Okay. And then final question for me. I would be interested in hearing your thoughts on the retail front. I think you guys have been doing some business with respect to national accounts on returns or waste disposal on large retail customers. Any thoughts on that?

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: Yes. If we could remind everybody again on the StrongPak offering, it's a unique offering, assisting retail to dispose of both hazardous waste and Rx Waste. We continue to build off our med waste offering. So we do have good coverage in accounts in the re
componenttext: Yes. If we could remind everybody again on the StrongPak offering, it's a unique offering, assisting retail to dispose of both hazardous waste and Rx Waste. We continue to build off our med waste offering. So we do have good coverage in accounts in the retail space. We're picking up items like med waste and pharmaceutical waste. So we continue to see a lot of regulatory compliance, and retail is getting a lot of focus in this area. And where there's opportunities, we're out in the marketplace trying to expand that service offering. We're excited about that offering.

headline: Stericycle, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Oct 24, 2012
componenttextpreview: There are no further questions at this time. I turn the call back over to the presenters.
componenttext: There are no further questions at this time. I turn the call back over to the presenters.
